com.gembox.spreadsheet

Class Top10Filter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gembox.spreadsheet.Filter
      • com.gembox.spreadsheet.Top10Filter

  • public final class Top10Filter
extends Filter
    Represents a filter that filters by a top N (percent or number of items).
    See Also:
    AutoFilter for examples which show various ways to specify and apply a filter to a range of cells, Excel AutoFiltering example

      • getFilterType

        public FilterType getFilterType()
        Gets the FilterType.TOP_10 value.
        Specified by:
        getFilterType in class Filter
        Returns:
        The FilterType.TOP_10 value.

      • getValue

        public double getValue()
        Gets the top or bottom value to use as the filter criteria. For example "Filter by Top 10 Percent" or "Filter by Top 5 Items".
        Returns:
        The top or bottom value to use as the filter criteria.

      • isPercent

        public boolean isPercent()

        Gets a value indicating whether or not to filter by percent value of the column. A false value filters by number of items.

        Default value is false.

        Returns:
        true to filter by percent value of the column; otherwise, false.

      • isTop

        public boolean isTop()

        Gets a value indicating whether or not to filter by top order. A false value filters by bottom order.

        Default value is true.

        Returns:
        true to filter by top order; otherwise, false.

      • setPercent

        public void setPercent(boolean percent)

        Sets a value indicating whether or not to filter by percent value of the column. A false value filters by number of items.

        Default value is false.

        Parameters:
        percent - true to filter by percent value of the column; otherwise, false.

      • setTop

        public void setTop(boolean top)

        Sets a value indicating whether or not to filter by top order. A false value filters by bottom order.

        Default value is true.

        Parameters:
        top - true to filter by top order; otherwise, false.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(double value)
        Sets the top or bottom value to use as the filter criteria. For example "Filter by Top 10 Percent" or "Filter by Top 5 Items".
        Parameters:
        value - The top or bottom value to use as the filter criteria.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Value must be greater than zero.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a String that represents this Top10Filter instance.

        This method should be used primarily for debugging purposes and should be considered volatile (format of its return value might change in future versions).

        Specified by:
        toString in class Filter
        Returns:
        A String that represents this Top10Filter instance.
